      void initialize(javafx.scene.chart.NumberAxis axis, java.lang.String label, javafx.scene.layout.HBox labelBox, org.controlsfx.control.RangeSlider filterSlider, javafx.scene.control.Button btnInvert, javafx.scene.control.Button btnLeft, javafx.scene.control.Button btnRight)
      supports the basic constructor by setting the values AFTER already creating the axis for now, this is the approach which is used when calling bindAxes in the chart
      void invert()
      Inverts the axis by negating both lower and upper values this seems to be the only efficient and easy way to correctly display the values

      • registerDragAndDropListener

        public void registerDragAndDropListener(ParallelCoordinatesChart chart,
                                        ParallelCoordinatesChart.DragAndDropLabel labelDragAndDrop)
        Register
        Parameters:
        chart - the ParallelCoordinatesChart on which the drag and drop listener for this axis will be registered
        labelDragAndDrop - the label between the axis which connects the DragAndDrop listeners

      • setTickLabelFormatter

        private void setTickLabelFormatter()
        Registers a TickLabelFormatter which also correctly displays values for the inverted axis

      • invert

        public void invert()
        Inverts the axis by negating both lower and upper values this seems to be the only efficient and easy way to correctly display the values
